The control of fire and the development of more sophisticated tools, such as stone knives and spears, marked significant milestones in human evolution. As populations grew, so did the need for more complex social structures, such as tribal organizations. Eventually, humans migrated out of Africa and into other parts of the world. The invention of the bow and arrow around 70,000 years ago further expanded human capabilities.
